job_data.title: Product Manager, Physical Retail Sales & Service
job_data.description:
**Who We Are \[Physical Retail Sales \& Service]**



Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, UX design, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that we’re building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. We have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing, and personalization. We’re a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.



The Physical Retail Sales \& Service team is responsible for the technology experience that powers our brick\-and\-mortar stores. The Product Manager in this role will unify two core areas of focus: (1\) enabling customer self\-service through tools like digital displays, e\-labels, and our in\-store mobile app, and (2\) equipping store associates with a bespoke point of sale system that integrates seamlessly with our specialty, omni\-channel sales and service tools.



This role will own initiatives spanning the end\-to\-end in\-store experience – from “See in Store” discovery on our e\-commerce platform, to complex assisted purchases like renovation projects, to post\-sale support like returns. You’ll shape how customers shop independently and how associates assist with confidence.


**What You’ll Do**


* Define and deliver experiences that help customers explore, discover, and transact independently in physical retail environments.
* Drive integration and optimization of tools for store associates, including selling tools, POS, and customer service interactions.
* Own cross\-domain initiatives spanning in\-store and online journeys to simplify complex purchases and promote expert\-supported sales.
* Partner with design, engineering, analytics, and retail stakeholders to build scalable, measurable solutions that improve conversion, satisfaction, and operational efficiency.
* Manage cross\-functional projects from discovery through delivery, ensuring tight alignment with physical retail strategy.
* Translate complex workflows into clear product requirements and cross\-domain contracts.
* Champion associate and customer needs while balancing business goals and technical constraints.
* Communicate product vision and progress to stakeholders across the company, including senior leadership.


**What You’ll Need**


* 4\+ years building software products at scale from concept to launch and beyond.
* Experience with consumer\-facing or retail associate tools preferred.
* Strong technical background and ability to break down complex problems into incremental value delivery.
* Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills across technical and non\-technical audiences.
* Comfort with data and a passion for using it to drive decision\-making; SQL a plus.
* Understanding of how tools and platforms integrate in omni\-channel retail settings.
* A bias for action and customer\-focused innovation mindset.

**About Wayfair Inc.**



Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry\-leading technology and creative problem\-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.



No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk\-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well\-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.



Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (https://www.wayfair.com/careers/privacy). If you have any questions or wish to exercise your rights under applicable privacy and data protection laws, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.

job_data.title: Senior Product Manager, Talent Solutions
job_data.description:
***An Important Note about Wayfair's In\-Office Policy and Salary:***



Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, MA, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.

  



The salary range for this position is $161,000 \- $172,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will also be provided as part of the compensation package.

  


**Who We Are:**



At Wayfair, we’re transforming how people shop for their homes—and that same spirit of innovation drives how we scale our global workforce. The Talent Technology team sits at the intersection of People, Process, and Product, delivering solutions that power every stage of the employee journey.

  



As a Senior Product Manager, Talent Technology, you will lead end\-to\-end initiatives that redefine how employees experience support—from process design to systems implementation. You’ll own high\-impact projects that streamline operations, drive AI\-powered self\-service, and reduce manual intervention across the HR ecosystem. This role requires strong systems thinking, comfort with technical complexity, and the ability to align diverse stakeholders around common priorities. You’ll be responsible for evaluating and implementing third\-party solutions, redesigning business processes, and improving interoperability across platforms like Workday, Alight, Avature, Verint, and other HR technologies.

  


**What You’ll Do:**


* Drive the strategy and execution of AI\-enabled self\-service capabilities that reduce friction and empower employees
* Lead vendor evaluations and manage full lifecycle implementation of new tools, ensuring alignment with architectural and business goals
* Redesign and streamline process flows across core HR areas (e.g., recruiting, onboarding, time tracking, payroll, benefits)
* Uncover and address manual processes by leveraging Workday capabilities and other system features
* Lead discovery and reconfiguration efforts within Workday to optimize core workflows and drive measurable efficiencies
* Define and maintain a product roadmap that balances speed, scale, and long\-term impact
* Drive organization\-wide change management strategies, plan for successful adoption, and manage the learning curve across diverse stakeholder groups
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams (Engineering, Legal, HR, Compliance) to align on technical feasibility, requirements, and compliance needs
* Translate complex business needs into clear product features, user flows, and outcomes
* Leverage data, experimentation, and feedback to drive continuous improvement
* Act as the connective tissue across stakeholder groups, ensuring shared understanding, accountability, and adoption

  


**What You’ll Need**


* 6–10 years of experience in product management or HR technology in a complex, matrixed environment
* Proven ability to lead end\-to\-end product delivery—from vendor selection through implementation and change adoption
* Strong systems thinking with experience mapping and redesigning workflows for efficiency
* Demonstrated success enabling automation, AI/ML, or self\-service tools within enterprise ecosystems
* Expertise managing and integrating core HR systems like Workday, Avature, Verint, and related tools
* Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and prioritization skills
* Experience navigating ambiguity, balancing tradeoffs, and aligning business and technical teams

  


**Why You’ll Love Wayfair:**


* Time Off:
* + Paid Holidays
	+ Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Health \& Wellness:
* + Full Health Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA)
	+ Life Insurance
	+ DIsability Protection (Short Term \& Long Term DIsability)
	+ Global Wellbeing: Gym/Fitness discounts (including US Peloton, Global ClassPass, and various regional gym memberships)
	+ Mental Health Support (Global Mental Health, Global Wayhealthy Recordings)
	+ Caregiver Services
* Financial Growth \& Security:
* + 401K Matching (Employee Matching Program)
	+ Tuition Reimbursement
	+ Financial Health Education (Knowledge of Financial Education \- KOFE)
	+ Tax Advantaged Accounts
* Family Support:
* + Family Planning Support
	+ Parental Leave
	+ Global Surrogacy \& Adoption Policy
* Professional Development \& Recognition:
* + Rewards \& Recognition
	+ Global Employee Anniversary Awards
	+ Paid Volunteer Work
* Unique Perks:
* + Employee Discount
	+ U.S. Bluebikes Membership
	+ Global Pod Outings
* Work/Life Balance:
* + Emphasizing a supportive \& flexible work environment that encourages a balance between personal and professional commitments

We are looking forward to your application!
